lines.gurmukhi: jYsy hIrw hwQ mY qnk so idKweI dyq mol kIey dmkn Brq BMfwr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Heeraa Haad Mai Tanak So Dikhaaee Dayta , Mol Keeay Damakan Bharat Bhandaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a diamond held in hand seems very small but when evaluated and sold, fills the coffers.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy br bwDy huMfI lwgq n Bwr kCu AwgY jwie pweIAq lCmI Apwr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bar Baadhay Houndee Laagat N Bhaar Kachhu , Aagai Jaai Paaeeat Lachhamee Apaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a cheque/draft carried on person has no weight but when cashed at the other end yields much money

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bit bIj Aiq sUKm srUp hoq boey sY ibibiD krY ibrKw ibsQwr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bati Beej Ati Sookham Saroop Hota , Boay Sai Bibidhi Karai Birakhaa Bisadaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as seed of a banyan tree is very small but when sown grows into big tree and spreads all over.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur bcn scn gurisKn mY jwnIAY mhwqm gey hI hirduAwr jI ]373]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Bachan Sachan Gursikhan Mai , Jaaneeai Mahaatam Gaay Hee Hariduaar Jee ?373?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similar is the significance of the lodging of true Guru's teachings in the hearts of obedient Sikhs of the Guru. This is reckoned only on reaching the divine court of the Lord. (The practitioners of Naam are honoured in His court).  (373)
